title: US actor Danny Masterson found guilty on two rape counts
description: Three women said the actor sexually assaulted them at his Hollywood home between 2001-03.

title: Warhammer: Royal Mail issues stamps to mark game's 40th anniversary
description: Warhammer is a fantasy theme game, described as "a British institution and a global success".

title: Health alert system aims to cut heatwave deaths
description: The aim is to protect the most vulnerable as high temperatures become more common due to climate change.

title: Covid loan: 'It's more than I spend on fish a month"
description: Firms struggling to repay pandemic debt should be given more flexibility, a business lobby group says.

title: FA Cup: The girl in the Gang - being Wimbledon's physio at 1988 final
description: Caroline Brouwer spent more than a decade at the heart of one of the most celebrated and notorious dressing rooms in English football, after unknowingly signing up to Wimbledon's 'Crazy Gang'.

title: AI: War crimes evidence erased by social media platforms
description: Footage of potential human rights abuses may be lost after platforms delete it, the BBC has found.

title: Argentina allows morning-after pill to be bought over counter
description: The health ministry says making the pill more easily available "removes an important barrier".

title: French Open 2023: Novak Djokovic stands by Kosovo message after criticism
description: Novak Djokovic has stood by the political message he wrote on a camera lens about Kosovo, saying it is an issue he "stands for".

title: Sevilla 1-1 Roma (4-1 on pens): Gonzalo Montiel scores winning penalty as La Liga side lift seventh Europa League
description: Sevilla claim a record-extending seventh Europa League title as they beat Roma on penalties at a raucous Puskas Arena in Budapest.

title: Daniel Knott: Mum's heartbreak at online video of son's body
description: Daniel Knott's mother says her grief has been amplified by a video of his body being shared online.

title: Steph Houghton: Ex-England captain was considered for World Cup spot
description: England manager Sarina Wiegman says former captain Steph Houghton was "in our conversations" despite being left out of the World Cup squad.

title: Women's World Cup: Lionesses duo reap reward for 'brave' January moves
description: Beth Mead's exclusion from England's Women's World Cup squad was a disappointment but not a surprise - instead there was reward for two players who made bold moves in January.

title: Amazon to pay $30m over Alexa and Ring privacy violations
description: It will also pay out after allowing employees of its Ring doorbell system access to customer recordings.

title: Every Canadian cigarette will soon carry a health warning
description: Canada will be the first country to have warning labels on the tipping paper of individual cigarettes.

title: Menopause and periods guidance is a 'magnificent step forward'
description: A new workplace standard for women with periods or the menopause has been published.

title: UFOs: What we learned from Nasa's public meeting
description: Some sightings turn out to be wayward Bart Simpson balloons. Others remain a mystery.

title: Bournemouth beach: Two people pulled from the sea
description: HM Coastguard says both have been passed to the care of the ambulance service.

title: Diddy says Diageo neglected his tequila due to race
description: The artist says the business relationship with the drinks giant was "tainted by racial prejudices".

title: London Irish takeover deadline extended despite 50% salaries
description: The Rugby Football Union grants London Irish a one-week extension until 6 June to complete their takeover.

title: Ryder Cup: Brooks Koepka 'deserves' to play but not Europe's LIV Golf players, says Rory McIlroy
description: Rory McIlroy says Brooks Koepka "deserves" to play in the Ryder Cup but is still opposed to Europe's LIV Golf players taking part.

title: Lionel Messi: Argentine set for decision on future - and it won't be Barcelona
description: Lionel Messi is set to decide where he will play football next season and it seems certain it won't be Barcelona.

title: French Open 2023 results: Cameron Norrie beats Lucas Pouille at Roland Garros
description: Britain's Cameron Norrie matches his best run at the French Open by ruthlessly swatting aside home hope Lucas Pouille to reach the third round.

title: Cannich wildfire could be largest recorded in UK
description: Firefighters say flames burned through a 30 sq mile area near Cannich but it is now under control.

title: Phillip Schofield: ITV announces external review of how it handled affair
description: The network sets up an externally led review of how it handled the affair to "establish the facts".

title: Boris Johnson says he has handed over Covid WhatsApps
description: The inquiry into the pandemic is demanding the government release the unredacted messages by Thursday.

title: Mental health services that fail to improve could be shut, says watchdog
description: The Care Quality Commission warning comes after Priory Group's biggest hospital is told to improve.

title: Bodycam footage shows car launching off tow truck's ramp on Georgia highway
description: The driver launched the car through the air before crash landing onto another car on the road.

title: Yugoslav war: UN increases sentence on two Serbian war criminals
description: Jovica Stanišic and Franko Simatovic trained death squads accused of ethnic cleansing, the Hague says.

title: Steaks and coffee protected in stores as shoplifting soars
description: Shoplifting offences are at their highest level in four years as the cost of living soars.

title: England v Ireland: Josh Tongue Test debut to earn punter £50,000
description: When Josh Tongue walks out at Lord's on Thursday he will not only earn his first Test cap, but also £50,000 for a family friend who placed an unlikely bet 14 years ago.

title: Ealing murder: Obsessive ex-boyfriend jailed for murdering woman
description: Dennis Akpomedaye killed Anna Jedrkowiak, 21, known as Ania, after ambushing her in an alleyway.

title: Auschwitz Museum condemns Polish ruling party video
description: The museum said a video released by the ruling PiS party is an insult to the camp's victims.

title: Mayor calls MP 'liar and a coward' in Tees project row
description: Conservative Ben Houchen attacked Labour's Andy McDonald over "corruption" allegations at Teesworks.

title: NHS backs new wafer to prevent migraines
description: Rimegepant will be available only to adults who have tried at least three other preventative drugs.

title: Ukraine war: Dashcam captures moment missile debris falls onto Kyiv road
description: The incident happened on 29 May during a rare daytime attack on the city, no one was injured.

title: England v Ireland: Ben Stokes says he will play full part in Ashes unless he 'can't walk'
description: Captain Ben Stokes says the only way he will not take a full part in England's Ashes summer is if he "can't walk".

title: England Women's World Cup squad: Beth Mead left out, Beth England in
description: Euro 2022 top scorer Beth Mead is not included in England's Women's World Cup squad, having not recovered from an anterior cruciate ligament injury.

title: French Open 2023 results: Stefanos Tsitsipas beats Roberto Carballes Baena to reach third round
description: Fifth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas reaches the French Open third round with a straight-set victory over Spain's Roberto Carballes Baena.

title: Women's World Cup: Five European governments want quick agreement on TV rights
description: The governments of five countries urge broadcasters and Fifa to "quickly reach an agreement" on Women's World Cup TV rights, with only 50 days until the tournament begins.

title: Peas that don't taste like peas could help the planet
description: UK researchers are developing peas that don't taste like peas as an environmentally friendly alternative to soya.

title: Local elections 2023: Did voters punish failing councils?
description: We looked at four failing English councils to find out whether they paid the price at the ballot box.

title: Why row about Boris Johnson's Covid WhatsApp messages matters
description: A stand-off over Boris Johnson's submissions to the Covid inquiry spells trouble for the government.

title: Ted Lasso's Phil Dunster on tackling mental health in hit show
description: Phil Dunster, aka Jamie Tartt in the series, tells Newsbeat about the range of issues the show addresses.

title: England v Ireland: Irish out to complete treble over Lord's hosts
description: Ireland have shocked England in both white-ball formats and now aim to make their Test breakthrough at Lord's.

title: UN begins salvage operation to stop catastrophic oil spill off Yemen
description: The FSO Safer, moored off Yemen's coast, holds more than a million barrels of oil.

title: French Open 2023: Novak Djokovic criticised for message about Kosovo after first-round win
description: Novak Djokovic's political message about Kosovo at the French Open was "not appropriate", says France's sports minister.

title: Sia reveals autism diagnosis, two years after film backlash
description: The pop star says the diagnosis has allowed her to "become fully, fully myself".

title: Al Pacino: The Godfather star expecting fourth child aged 83
description: The Godfather star has announced his 29-year-old girlfriend Noor Alfallah is eight months pregnant.

title: CBI president in early exit as lobby giant fights to survive
description: Brian McBride is to step down earlier than planned after the body was rocked by allegations of misconduct.

title: Rhys Webb: Scrum-half announces Wales retirement aged 34
description: Rhys Webb joins fellow Ospreys Alun Wyn Jones and Justin Tipuric in retiring from Wales duty before the 2023 World Cup.

title: North Korean satellite wakes up and worries Seoul
description: It comes as North Korea attempted to launch a satellite, but a fault caused it to crash into the sea.

title: Labour defends donations from Just Stop Oil backer Dale Vince
description: The donations do not affect the party's views on the campaign group, a shadow minister says.

title: Secret Tory: Henry Morris unmasks himself as man behind parody account
description: The satirical Twitter account has built up nearly 200,000 followers since its launch in 2019.

title: Vaping: We should follow Australia's ban, says teacher
description: Australia is set to ban recreational vaping, with vapes only available by prescription only.

title: I, Daniel Blake star Dave Johns hopes stage adaptation will 'make people angry'
description: The award-winning film about poverty returns as a stage show to highlight the cost-of-living crisis.

title: Glastonbury: Rick Astley rolls on to BBC Breakfast in his pyjamas
description: Never one to give up or let fans down, Rick Astley made sure he was on time for BBC Breakfast

title: Chhattisgarh: India official fined $640 for draining dam to find phone
description: The man ordered millions of litres to be drained after dropping his phone while taking a selfie.

title: Josh Tongue: Meet England's new bowler who had Botox injections to save career
description: From having Botox injections to preparing to make his Test debut - meet Worcestershire's Josh Tongue, England's latest fast bowler.

title: Disruption as fresh wave of train strikes begins
description: Train drivers will walk out on Wednesday, with further strikes planned for Friday and Saturday.

title: Rhodes death: Man 'struck by lightning while paddleboarding'
description: A man from Liverpool was struck by lightning while in the sea off Rhodes, local reports say.

title: Wrestlers' protest: IOC says police action against Indian athletes very disturbing
description: International Olympic Committee demands criminal investigation into sexual harassment allegations.

title: Former Coventry Ikea to house cultural hub and art storage
description: The Coventry store, which closed due to low customer numbers, will reopen as an arts venue in 2025.

title: Europa League final: Jose Mourinho is Roma's Messiah, but is this farewell for the 'Special One'?
description: Jose Mourinho is chasing back-to-back European trophies with Roma, but will the Europa League final be farewell for the 'Special One'.

title: 2023 Women's World Cup: 50 days to go until Australia and New Zealand co-host tournament
description: Organisers of the Women's World Cup, which starts in 50 days, say they are closing in on one million ticket sales.

title: Police initiative to tackle racism accused of being racist
description: The action plan is facing allegations of racism from some of the ethnic minority staff involved.

title: Ukraine war: The mothers going to get their children back from Russia
description: Russia is taking Ukrainian children. Their mothers are travelling into enemy territory to save them.

title: Navigating the two sides of Somalia's capital Mogadishu
description: Journalist Soraya Ali travels to Somalia to see if it really is how her mother remembers it.
